intro: Leucocnide affinis, commonly known as the climbing shrub or velvetleaf, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with prominent veins and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Leucocnide affinis is often found in moist, shaded environments and can become invasive in certain regions.
